data.title: Victor Emmanuel IV, King of Italy
data.meta_description: Victor Emmanuel IV, King of Italy (born Prince Victor Emmanuel of Italy on 2 February 1937) is the current reigning King of Italy. He is the only son of King Umberto II of Italy and Princess Marie-Jose of Belgium. Victor Emmanuel became the heir apparent to the Italian throne upon the abdication...
data.text:
Victor Emmanuel IV, King of Italy (born Prince Victor Emmanuel of Italy on 2 February 1937) is the current reigning King of Italy. He is the only son of King Umberto II of Italy and Princess Marie-Jose of Belgium.

Life[]

Victor Emmanuel became the heir apparent to the Italian throne upon the abdication of his grandfather, King Victor Emmanuel III, on 9 May 1946. He succeeded to the throne upon the death of his father on 16 March 1983.

On 1 January 1987, during New Year Court celebrations, the king officially signed letters patent changing the Italian succession to absolute primogeniture. This made his young daughter, Victoria, his heiress apparent as his eldest legitimate child.

Marriage and Issue[]

After an nineteen-year relationship with Swiss heiress (but commoner) Marina Doria, King Umberto II forced his son to end the relationship and find a "suitable" wife.

On 16 April 1981, Victor Emmanuel's engagement to TBD was announced. Victor Emmanuel and TBD couple were married with great fanfare in Rome on 7 October 1981. The couple have four children, Victoria, Michele, Bona, and Victor Amadeus.

In 2002, it was revealed by an Italian tabloid newspaper that Victor Emmanuel and his long-time partner, Marina Doria, had secretly had a son in 1973, Emanuele Doria. who had lived most of his life in Switzerland with his mother. On 10 November 2002, the Italian court released a statement confirming Emanuele Doria's paternity. Shortly after, as part of his New Year's Court, the king announced that Emanuele would be known as Emanuele di Savoia, and bestowed the title of Count of Salemi on him. However, he is not considered a member of the Royal Family, nor does he have any official public function. Through Emanuele, Victor Emmanuel has two additional grandchildren, Countess Vittoria di Salemi and Countess Luisa di Salemi.

Residences[]

Titles and Honours[]

1940-1946 Prince Victor Emmanuel of Italy

1946-1983 Victor Emmanuel, Crown Prince of Italy

1983-present Victor Emmanuel IV, King of Italy

National Honours[]

Order of the Most Holy Annunciation (1981)

Order of Sts. Maurice and Lazarus (1983)

Order of the Crown (1958)

Order of the Star of Italy (1983)

Foreign Honours[]

TBD
